entry.title: 5 Reasons Why “Mother Nature” is a Key Stakeholder
entry.summary: For years, companies have treated the environment as an externality. The environment is not on their radar screens of stakeholders to whom they need to pay attention. Stakeholders are defined as “anybody who can affect, or is affected by, an organisation, strategy or project.” The environment is not a body / person. Maybe calling it “Mother Nature” would personify it enough for it to qualify as an “anybody.” There are five reasons why it’s time to treat Mother Nature as a key stakeholder. Read ...
